bibl.title: Letter from A. Connal to Wickliffe Rose, January 17, 1923

div1.p: Connal will send information on yellow fever cases to Noguchi.

div1.head: Letter from A. Connal to Wickliffe Rose, January 17, 1923
div1.opener:
COPY
Medical Research Institute
Yaba,
(near Lagos, West Africa)
January 17, 1923
Dear Dr. Wickliffe Rose:
div1.p:
I am at last able to send some yellow fever material for Dr.
Hideyo Noguchi. The case occurred whilst I was home on leave but I have collected
all the reports concerning it, with the exception of the Pathological Report by
Dr. Young, who acted for me when I was on leave. I hope to send a copy of this
later.

As regards the second case, I think you will agree that it seems to
be a very remarkable proof of the efficacy of the curative serum.

I shall be very grateful if, in due course, I may receive Dr. Noguchi's
opinion on the material.
div1.closer:
Yours sincerely, (Signed) A. Connal (reference your letter of
April 25, 1921)
